According to ancient sources includingPliny the ElderandAristotle, in 467 BC a largemeteoritelanded near Aegospotami. He described it as brown in colour and the size of a wagon load; it was a local landmark for more than 500 years. A comet, tentatively identified asHalley's Comet, was reported at the time the meteorite landed. This is possibly the first European record of Halley's comet.cite bookComets: A Chronological History of Observation, Science, Myth and FolkloreDonald K.
